text: Mary Elizabeth "Liz" Smith (February 2, 1923 - November 12, 2017) was an American gossip columnist. She was known as The Grand Dame of Dish. She was a journalist for the New York Daily Times. Smith was born on February 2, 1923 in Fort Worth, Texas. She was raised in New York City. Smith studied at the University of Texas at Austin. She worked for five years at CBS Radio with Mike Wallace. She was married to George Edward until they divorced. She was bisexual.www.cnn.com. Smith died at her Manhattan apartment on November 12, 2017 of natural causes at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other websites== * copy of transcript of her interview with CNN's Larry King Category:1923 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American columnists Category:Bisexual people Category:Journalists from New York City Category:Journalists from Texas Category:LGBT journalists Category:LGBT people from New York City Category:LGBT people from Texas Category:Writers from Fort Worth, Texas Category:American LGBT writers
title: Liz Smith (journalist)
